posts.name: Jessie Kelly
posts.cooked:
Our robot keeps drifting to one side whenever we try to move straight. We know that this problem is not a mechanical issue however we can’t find anything wrong with the code that would lead to this.

This screenshot is from the log file from the driver station. Screenshot 2023-03-04 140034 1920×1020 287 KB

Screenshot 2023-03-04 140034 1920×1020 287 KB

Screenshot 2023-03-04 140034 1920×1020 287 KB

Here is a link to our code GitHub code

posts.name: philso
posts.cooked: Please post photos of your chassis. How did your team determine that it is not a mechanical issue? What tests have been done?

posts.name: Jessie Kelly
posts.cooked:
Here’s what’s been done so far:

checked friction on both sides via hand

disabled and * kicked * the bot travels straight

disassembled and verified the same gear ratio on both sides

checked and corrected an initial wire issue

We did find that one motor is drawing more than the others and are trying to trouble shoot that one atm

posts.name: philso
posts.cooked: Are you using the KOP chassis? If you are, check that all the pinion gears on the 4 motors are the same. We had a similar problem many years ago and struggled with it all season. After the season ended, we found out it was possible for a pinion with fewer teeth to fit. We had re-used motors from previous years.

posts.name: Zach Hoegberg
posts.cooked:
6791:

one motor is drawing more than the others

How much is the drivetrain drifting by? How much more current is the anomalous motor pulling?

posts.name: Jessie Kelly
posts.cooked: If someone check the code, please. The code was updated with restore Factory Defaults for the Spark Max motor controllers. It is updated through the GitHub link.

posts.name: Fletch
posts.cooked:
Zaque:

How much is the drivetrain drifting by? How much more current is the anomalous motor pulling?

Definitely this.  We need a more quantitative description of what’s going on
